Store Manager Job at Persianas Retail Limited




        
    

        
        Persianas Retail Limited (PRL) is a leading retail company in Nigeria that offers an array of fashion and lifestyle products and services to customers across Nigeria. We have built valuable partnerships with renowned brands over the years, cementing our reputation as a trusted retail leader. Our extensive distribution channels include physical stores,e-commerce, and Wholesale Distributors.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Store Manager

Job Location: Lekki, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	PRL is seeking a dynamic and results-driven Store Manager to oversee daily retail operations.
	This role is key to ensuring exceptional customer service, driving sales, and leading a high-performing team.
	The ideal candidate will have a strong retail background, excellent leadership skills, and a passion for delivering outstanding in-store experiences.


Key Responsibilities


	Lead and motivate the sales team to meet and exceed sales targets
	Ensure high levels of customer satisfaction through excellent service
	Oversee store operations, administration, and compliance
	Maintain strong visual merchandising and store presentation standards
	Manage inventory, budgeting, and cost control
	Recruit, train, and mentor staff
	Handle customer and staff issues professionally.


Requirements


	Candidates should possess a Bachelor's Degree with 5+ years of experience in a similar retail management role.
	Proficient with POS systems and retail software
	Strong communication and leadership skills
	Ability to resolve issues efficiently and professionally
	Excellent organizational and time management abilities
	Solid understanding of the retail sales process.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: hr@persianasretail.com using "Store Manager Lekki" as the subject of the mail.

title: Job Vacancies at Ecobank Nigeria Plc
content:
Ecobank Transnational Incorporated (ETI), a public limited liability company, was established as a bank holding company in 1985 under a private sector initiative spearheaded by the Federation of West African Chambers of Commerce and Industry with the support of the Economic Community of West African States (ECOWAS).

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Market and Industry Trend Analyst

Job Identification: 1079
Job Location: Victoria Island, Lagos
Job Schedule: Full time

Job Description
Industry and Market Trend Analysis:
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Track developments in the financial services industry (e.g. CBN regulations, fintech disruption, inflation, interest rates, FX dynamics).
	Monitor macroeconomic indicators that affect lending, deposits, investment products, and customer behavior


Competitor Benchmarking:


	Analyze competitor banks’ products, pricing, branch expansion, digital offerings, and campaigns.
	Provide competitive intelligence reports for business units, senior management, and strategic teams.


Customer & segment Insights:


	Study customer acquisition, retention, and churn rates across segments (Retail, SME, HNWI, LOC & EFS).
	Identify behavioral trends in channel usage, digital adoption, and product uptake (cards, loans, savings, etc.).


Performance Reporting and Dashboarding:


	Develop and maintain dashboards (Power BI, Excel) showing market share, revenue trends, and segment performance.
	Generate reports that track product penetration, fee income, and cross-sell ratios.


Support Strategic Initiatives:


	Provide intelligence to support product development, new market entry, branch optimization, and digital transformation.
	Assist in pricing strategies, marketing campaign planning, and competitor threat assessments.


Collaboration Across Business Units:


	Work with Retail, Commercial, LOC, HNWI, Payment and Strategy teams to supply tailored insights.
	Support quarterly business reviews, board reporting, and investment/expansion decisions.


Experience & Qualifications


	Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics or Business Management
	Working knowledge of data mining using SQL, ETL, and Excel
	Demonstrated experience in executing presentations of technical and business level data.
	Knowledge and familiarity with Tableau is a plus
	Proven ability to synthesize analytics and research results into clear insights, and to deliver actionable recommendations.
	Business writing and presentation skills for executive reporting
	Ability to link market signals with financial impact.


Application Closing Date: 12th November, 2025; 08:19 PM.

Click here to apply online

 

 

2.) Product Officer, Liabilities

Job Identification: 1079
Job Location: Victoria Island, Lagos
Job Schedule: Full time

Job Description
Business Development and Financial performance:


	Assist with the development of segment specific products and services in conjunction with the segment heads to drive Personal Banking business.
	Constantly monitor performance of PB liability products to ensure profitability and efficiency. 
	Develop and implement strategies for converting prospects to profitable customer relationships.
	Prepare market research report showing competitive edge of Ecobank, in terms of product pricing, product/service offerings, customer perception, peer comparison (at least 3 PB focused Banks) as well as recommended strategies.
	Liaise with other support units such as technology, payment, marketing, operations etc. to drive implementation of the communicated strategic goals and objectives for the team.
	Supports the front-line sales staff for effective selling of the bank’s products and services.


Loyalty Management:


	Identify and sign-up/Renew Lifestyle benefits partners for Personal Banking customers.
	Ensure adequate spread and flavour in our bouquet of loyalty packages.
	Drive usage/patronage of loyalty schemes by PB customers 
	Maintain close and cordial relationship with loyalty partners.
	Ensure prompt resolution of all customer service issues relating to loyalty reward schemes.
	Track and provide periodic reports on Life-style partner activity level and propose modification to contracts where appropriate.


Customer Excellence:


	Participate in customer focused events organized by Ecobank such as Market storms, customer forums, mystery shopping etc. Draft report on same making recommendations where necessary.
	In collaboration with CEX team, drive the execution of solutions addressing Complaint Root-cause analysis outcome.
	Ensure prompt resolution of all PB customer complaints and provide feedback within 48/72hrs.


People management:


	Work with the analytics team and consumer banking sales force to achieve the overall strategic objectives of CCB.


Process, control, and operational performance:


	Implement process of on boarding new Personal Banking customers. Monitor and track to ensure prompt and proper on boarding of every new Personal Banking customer across the Bank in line with the process.
	Drive strategies to reduce customer attrition, especially within the first 90days.
	Ensure full adherence to Operational Risk and Compliance guidelines across the Personal Banking business function e.g., KYC and anti-money laundering measures.
	Any other duties/functions given by the TL CCB Liability Products and Head, CCB Products & Analytics.


Strategic Initiatives:


	Think strategically – seeing the bigger picture and setting aims and objectives to develop and improve PB business. 
	Develop unique promotions and campaigns to win new relationships and retain existing customers


Experience & Qualification


	Minimum of 2nd class lower in First Degree (MBA, MSC, MA, ML and/or Professional Qualifications may be needed.
	Minimum of 3-5 years of working experience in financial services and the banking industry with specific responsibility for relationship management, product development and reviews.


Skills, Capabilities & Personal attributes:


	Excellent problem solving skills
	Must be analytical and have financial numeracy
	Strong analytical skills including financial statement analysis, competitive analysis, segmentation analysis and statistical analysis; experience with data gathering and data analysis 
	Excellent verbal and written communication skills 
	Experience in writing and delivering fact-based presentations and recommendations to Team leader and unit Head  
	Excellent command of English language  
	Strong Microsoft Office skills 


Application Closing Date: 12th November, 2025; 01:18 PM.

Click here to apply online

 

 

3.) Officer, Back Office Operations, EDC Securities Limited

Job Identification: 1110
Job Location: Victoria Island, Lagos
Job Schedule: Full time

Job Purpose 


	To assist the Securities Business in the management of the operations function to ensure operational efficiency and avoidance of loss and growth of the business in a profitable and cost-effective manner.
	To be responsible for the entire Securities Back Office Operational processes.


Job Context


	The role implies to be customer minded with abilities to address/escalate issues to the Head of Operations, Nigeria.
	The candidate is expected to constantly be on top of operational issues in the Securities space and provide the needed information, reporting.


Key Responsibilities


	Custodian of the overall operational process.
	Supervises the processing of various client requests- subscriptions, redemptions, transfer request, etc. for retail funds and purchases, sales and cash movements for institutional funds.
	Retail and institutional fund reconciliations with custodial cash positions.
	Resolving dealing-related enquiries by email and by telephone, supplying information relating to funds’ portfolios, prices, dealing procedures, markets.
	Liaising with parties to the fund such as custodians, registrars, auditors.
	Settlement of transactions into clients’ portfolios as per transaction contract notes.
	Supervises the Maintenance of subscribers’ register and investors files.
	Processing corporate actions and cash receipts such as dividend/interest payments.
	Semi-annual fund level reporting.
	Client statement preparation and reporting for both retail and institutional segments.
	Securities system liaison to ensure alignment with the operational process for both web and core versions.
	Ensuring compliance with anti-money laundering procedures.
	Rendering of returns to regulators and relevant statutory bodies.
	Carry out other duties that may be assigned from time to time.


Knowledge, Skills & Experience
Experience & Qualifications:


	First Degrees in a quantitative field.
	At least 3-5 years of proven experience in Securities space
	Professional qualification such as ACA, ACCA is desirable.
	Ability to implement procedures to ensure effectiveness and operational efficiency.
	Customer focused & result oriented.
	Good organizational and time management skills are highly desirable.
	Inclusive, flexible, savvy and sensitive to client culture/Customer excellence.


Skills, Capabilities & Direct Attributes:


	Great team spirit and strong communication skills are required, in order to develop and maintain effective working relationships both externally and internally.
	Result driven, excellent team player
	Empathizes and pays attention to details
	Proficiency in the use of Investment Management software applications
	Self-starter who can work on their own with minimal direct supervision
	Adopts a conscientious organized and logical approach to task completion
	Motivated by challenges and positive attitude towards work


Application Closing Date: 14th November, 2025; 08:28 AM.

Click here to apply online

     

    

        Click here to Apply

title: Job Openings at TeKnowledge
content:
At TeKnowledge, we turn complexity into clarity – and potential into progress. We go beyond problem-solving to transform how you grow. By blending cutting-edge technology with expert insight, we help enterprises, governments and tech vendors tackle their biggest challenges while preparing them for what’s next. From strategy to execution, we drive smarter, faster, and more sustained innovation—empowering organizations with the capability and control to lead with confidence.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) AI Developer

Job Location: Lagos
Job type: Full-time

About the job
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Design and develop terminal agents to execute structured engineering tasks through shell commands, scripting, and API integrations.
	Develop, optimize, and maintain build systems (e.g., CMake, Ninja, Makefiles) focusing on performance profiling and enhancements.
	Automate CI/CD workflows using GitHub Actions, ensuring adherence to modern best practices and compatibility with tools such as act.
	Construct ETL pipelines for log ingestion, validation, partitioning, and reporting utilizing formats including JSONL, Parquet, CSV, and HTML.
	Implement online learning algorithms (e.g., Thompson Sampling, UCB) for decision-making agents operating in constrained environments.
	Deploy secure containerized services (e.g., private Docker registries) with comprehensive TLS and authentication mechanisms.
	Produce reproducible metrics and benchmarking reports (e.g., metrics.json) to compare baseline and optimized system performance.
	Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define task specifications and contribute to open-source initiatives modeled after Terminal Bench.


Click here to apply online

 

2.) Marketing Manager 

Job Id: 2025-17143
Job Location: Victoria Island, Lagos
Job type: Full-time

About the job


	We’re seeking an experienced and results-driven Marketing Manager – GTM (Go-to-Market) to join our Africa regional team. In this role, you’ll be responsible for developing and executing integrated field marketing programs that drive demand generation, revenue growth, and brand visibility across the African market.
	At TeKnowledge, your work makes an impact from day one. We partner with organizations to deliver AI-First Expert Technology Services that drive meaningful impact in AI, Customer Experience, and Cybersecurity. We turn complexity into clarity and potential into progress—in a place where people lead and tech empowers.


Responsibilities


	Develop and Execute Integrated GTM Programs: Plan, budget, and deliver a portfolio of marketing events and campaigns — including trade shows, webinars, and customer engagement initiatives — to drive demand and revenue growth in the Africa region.
	Generate High-Quality Leads: Partner with Sales and Marketing teams to launch and manage integrated demand generation campaigns that nurture high-quality leads throughout the entire sales funnel.
	Localize Content and Messaging: Collaborate with content teams to adapt marketing materials, messaging, and customer success stories to reflect local market needs and cultural nuances.
	Manage External Communications: Build relationships with media outlets and industry influencers; oversee local PR efforts including press releases, media outreach, and event participation to enhance visibility and brand reputation.
	Track and Optimize ROI: Establish performance metrics for all marketing activities; regularly analyze lead quality, conversion rates, and campaign ROI to inform data-driven improvements.
	Budget Management: Oversee the regional marketing budget, ensuring effective cost control, accurate reporting, and financial accountability.
	Collaborate Across Teams: Build and maintain strong partnerships with regional sales leaders, product marketing, and senior management to ensure alignment on strategic GTM objectives.
	Maintain Market Expertise: Stay up to date with industry trends — including AI, customer experience (CX), data, and cybersecurity — to continuously refine strategies and maintain a competitive edge.


Qualifications


	Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Marketing, Economics, or a related field – required.
	5–9 years of experience in marketing management, field marketing, or go-to-market strategy within a B2B or technology environment.
	Master’s degree – preferred.
	Certification in Digital Marketing – advantageous.
	Proven success in developing and executing integrated marketing programs that drive measurable results.
	Experience in regional or international markets, preferably within Africa.
	Strategic mindset combined with hands-on execution ability.
	Strong project management, organizational, and multitasking skills.
	Excellent communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills.
	Proficiency with marketing automation platforms (e.g., HubSpot).
	Experience using CRM systems (e.g., Salesforce, Microsoft Dynamics).
	Strong analytical and data-driven decision-making capabilities.
	Financial acumen and budget management experience.
	Ability to work independently and collaboratively in cross-functional teams.
	Keen attention to detail and commitment to excellence.


Click here to apply online

 

 

3.) Sales Account Manager

Job ID: 16549
Job Location: Victoria Island, Lagos
Job type: Full-time

Overview


	We’re seeking a Sales Account Manager – Nigeria & West Africa to lead customer engagement and drive digital transformation for new clients, preferably in the banking sector.
	This is a full-time, remote role and is ideal for a seasoned sales leader with strong executive presence, deep expertise in B2B technology solutions, and a passion for growing strategic accounts across the region.


Responsibilities
Driving Growth through Focusing on the Customer:


	Maintain deep understanding of customer business needs, KPIs, and strategic priorities.
	Guide peers in aligning TeKnowledge solutions with customer goals and translating features into tangible business outcomes.
	Lead digital transformation initiatives that create business value and drive impact.
	Enable and coach cross-functional teams to co-develop strategic account plans.
	Align partner and internal resources to customer and industry-specific needs.
	Identify opportunities for new revenue, adoption, and customer relationship growth across the portfolio.


Sales & Business Excellence:


	Oversee revenue forecasting and progress tracking within the assigned portfolio and market segments.
	Set strategic goals and priorities, manage pipeline health, and drive alignment with business objectives.
	Guide planning and prioritization across multiple complex accounts.
	Lead execution of corrective actions in response to escalations or blockers, and drive root-cause resolution.
	Engage in contract negotiation, risk management, and revenue protection strategies.
	Foster a high-performing virtual team, ensuring consistent delivery excellence and customer satisfaction.


Strategic Relationship Management:


	Expand and manage a strong network of key decision-makers, partners, and stakeholders.
	Partner with internal teams and customers to develop long-term digital strategies.
	Drive strategic marketing and go-to-market initiatives in collaboration with business and technical leads.
	Identify and onboard new partners/vendors to accelerate growth in emerging markets.


Qualifications


	10+ years of experience in B2B technology/services sales and strategic account management.
	Proven knowledge in Cybersecurity, AI/Automation, Customer Experience (CX), professional services, or digital skilling/change management programs.
	Strong track record of new logo deals in the banking sector.
	Fluency in English and one or more regional languages.
	Strong executive presence with excellent written and verbal communication skills.
	Willingness and ability to travel within the Africa region.


Why You’ll Enjoy It Here 


	Be Part of Something Big – A growing company where your contributions matter.
	Make an Immediate Impact – Support groundbreaking technologies with real-world results.
	Work on Cutting-Edge Tech – AI, cybersecurity, and next-gen digital solutions.
	Thrive in an Inclusive Team – A culture built on trust, collaboration, and respect.
	We Care – Integrity, empathy, and purpose guide every decision.


Click here to apply online
